briefTitle: Manual Lymphatic Drainage Versus Standard Treatment for the Prevention of Breast Cancer-related Lymphoedema in Patients Who Undergo Axillary Node Clearance
officialTitle: Does a Regime of Manual Lymphatic Drainage Reduce the Incidence of Breast Cancer-related Lymphoedema Following Axillary Node Clearance: a Randomised Controlled Trial
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Patients with a new diagnosis of primary operable breast cancer
* Surgery will involve axillary lymph node clearance

Exclusion criteria:

* Patients with recurrent breast cancer
* Patients with previous axillary surgery
* Patients with previous axillary radiotheraphy
* Patients with previous arm/axillary pathology leading to arm volume changes
